title-group.article-title: A Bioclimatic Comfort Design Toolkit For High-Rise Buildings

permissions.copyright-statement: © 2017 Council on Tall Buildings and Urban Habitat

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.p: Building in an ever more urbanized world, with high-rise buildings increasing in both height and number, makes it essential to ensure we create comfortable urban spaces, as the urban microclimate in and around towers is affected dramatically. This paper proposes a new method of computational design that creates a continuous workflow, one that synthesizes the interaction of dynamic structural behavior, climate, and thermal comfort directly into the digital design process. The author’s team has developed a custom software interface that connects different aspects of the design (geometry, BIM, structural analysis, and computational fluid dynamics) in one workflow, allowing different members of the design team to interact simultaneously and inform the design in real time.
